subdisciplines.name: Comparative Political Behavior
subdisciplines.description: The study of how individuals and groups behave politically in different contexts and societies, and the factors that shape their behavior.

subdisciplines.name: Comparative Political Economy
subdisciplines.description: The study of how economic actors and institutions interact with political actors and institutions, and how this impacts political outcomes.

subdisciplines.name: Comparative Political Institutions
subdisciplines.description: The study of the structures, processes, and practices of political institutions in different countries and regions, and how they shape political outcomes.

subdisciplines.name: Comparative Political Methodology
subdisciplines.description: The study of the methods and techniques used to study politics comparatively, including research design, statistical analysis, and qualitative methods.

subdisciplines.name: Comparative Political Theory
subdisciplines.description: The study of political ideas, concepts, and principles across different cultures, societies, and historical periods, and how they shape political institutions and practices.
